inn1.comm: round the wicket, on leg stump and turned out to midwicket
short and turns down the leg side to get England under way
a touch fuller on middle and leg, Strauss works it into the leg side

gone! And the plan has work in some style. Massive early strike for South Africa. Strauss comes down the pitch and tries to launch Peterson over midwicket but can only find long on who makes superb ground to take a low catch
now there's a big appeal as Pietersen props forward but there's a big inside edge into the pad
uses his feet and whips this towards mid-on who gets a tough bounce which allows a second although Trott has to get his skates on
GONE! Would you believe it. Two in the first over. What an effort from Peterson. KP plays forward the ball turns a fraction and a regulation edge goes low to first slip
full on middle and off, hint of swing away from Bell who comes forward and defends solidly into the covers
angled down the leg side and clips the pad, Morne van Wyk makes a good save behind the stumps
nicely played from Trott who leans onto a square drive and finds a gap at cover to open his account
back of a length and Trott rides a touch more bounce into the leg side
onto the back foot and whipped off the hip down to long leg
on leg stump and it takes Bell's pad down towards fine leg who can't stop the second
round the wicket, on off stump and Trott defends into the off side
onto the front foot and pushed back down the pitch
that's ripped squared...beats Trott who was on the back foot as it spins past the outside edge
pushed through a little quicker and Trott defends out to silly point
goes deep in his crease and then works into the leg side...trying to give himself time to read any spin
tossed up on middle and off, solidly pushed into the off side
a testing full length on off stump, Bell stays on his crease and defends to the off side
very full this time and Bell jabs down on it
good response from Bell, Steyn went for the short ball but it sat up very gently and gave Bell plenty of time to pull it in front of square
drifts towards leg stump again and Bell flicks it down to fine leg who is quite square
back on a full length at middle stump, Trott works it out to mid-on and the bat twists in his hands
plays this very late with an open face and sends it down to third man
full on the stumps and punched down towards mid-on and there's nearly some confusion
pushed towards leg stump, whipped into the midwicket area off the back foot
tossed up, Bell gets his head over the line and defends

gone! He has another. Bell tries to use his feet but doesn't get to the pitch and only succeeds in popping a catch back towards Peterson who dives low to his left and takes a superb catch. Lovely piece of bowling to beat the batsman in flight
fired in very full at the stumps, Bopara digs it out into the off side
gee, there is plenty of turn here. Bopara nearly caught out on the back foot and he adjusts very late to defends square of the wicket
full on middle and off, pushed past short midwicket towards mid-on
little too straight and nicely played as he turns his wrists to send it through square leg
played off the back foot this time with an open face, it goes square of third man but they, rightly, don't risk the second
back of a length and Bopara defends into the off side
turned off his pads to get off the mark as he beats square leg, this time there is a chance to make it a three...a neat piece of timing from Bopara
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler and there are a few stares in the middle.
risky from Bopara as he goes onto the back to try and force through the off side but is cramped for room
angled towards leg stump, worked into the leg side
full on leg stump, turned along the ground to midwicket
worked off leg stump to short fine and Ravi decides to have a wander up the pitch before jogging back into his crease
onto the back foot and defends into the off side
touch shorter and it turns again but this time Bopara has time to play square on the off side
back of a length on off stump, defended into the leg side
well, well...Trott uses his feet and backs to the leg side, then frees his arms and carves this one bounce down to third man. Quite out of character.
fuller to Bopara and it's defended towards backward point
outside off, defended with an open face into the off side
full and wide, draws a drive from Bopara and the edge flies down to third man but quite safely
full on off stump and it's driven firmly down to mid-off
greeted by an elegant pull as he drops short on off stump...Bopara sends it through square leg
much fuller this time outside off, defended into the covers
full on middle and off, defended down to mid-on
that was fairly straight but it's neatly whipped through the leg side and they get a shift on between the wickets
that's a bouncer that has gone wrong...banged in very short and it's miles over the batsman's head as well as going down the leg side. Keeper couldn't do much
a slower ball which is dug out back to the bowler who fields one-handed and throws it back to the keeper
worked through the leg side again out to deep square
outside off, jabbed into the off side as Trott suggests he expected more bounce
opens the face and it goes one bounce to the man at a very wide slip position...probably about third/fourth slip
same man is in action again as Trott tries to find the gap down to third man...he should be alert for the catch, too
full on the stumps, worked out to midwicket without much timing
ooh, a strangled shout as Trott is caught on the back foot but height was an issue and maybe an edge too
dropped in short - not where you want to be on this surface - and Trott pulls it through square leg
full on middle and off, defended down to mid-on
risky from Trott as he moves towards the leg side and exposes his stumps the guides the ball to point
whipped off his hip down to long leg
comes across the crease and turns the ball to square leg...he doesn't want to miss one of those shots. Big lbw candidate.
back of a length on off stump, gives Bopara time to work it onto the leg side
an over of leg-side whips is completed by another which goes out to deep square
hint of width allows Trott to cut it away through backward point for just the second boundary of the day...wasn't timed perfectly but had the legs to beat third man
gets back full on off stump, Trott punches down the pitch and Morkel fields in his follow through
hint of movement into Trott from outside off as he comes onto the front foot and defends
full outside off, driven firmly into off side and it slips through short cover but it doesn't cost any runs
slower ball outside off, pushed into the off side and can't find a gap
wrong line again, pushed towards leg stump and it takes Trott's pad wide of the diving keeper down to fine leg
tossed up nicely on off stump, Bopara leans forward and opens the face to find space in the covers
very full and dug out back to the bowler
dragged a little short, Trott onto the back foot and forces out to the cover sweeper
driven back to the bowler
leans back and cuts to backward point
placed nicely through the covers and the sweeper has more work to do
beaten, Bopara pushed at a wide ball outside off without much footwork. Loose shot.
beaten again! This time a fuller ball which hints to swing away and draws Bopara onto the front foot with an airy drive
gets the edge this time, Bopara feeling for the ball and it goes between keeper and the very wide slip. Bopara tried to make it look like a glide, but there was more edge involved
stays on that line outside off and it's left alone this time
gets one to jag back into the right hander and takes him high on the pad...this is a good over
full outside off, defended square on the off side
given out! We have a review as Trott misses a sweep and is given lbw. He calls for the DRS. Is it turning enough to miss off stump? Indeed it's missing, a good review from Trott who survives
tossed up outside off and driven firmly to cover
plenty of flight again and driven back to the bowler
touch short outside off, cut hard but straight at cover
better line, full on middle which brings Trott forward to defend
onto the back foot and pushed into the covers
neatly angled away to third man for a single. The sort of shot that if Bopara had angled into the keeper's gloves, he would be vilified for
Steyn is a touch too straight, which is a cricketing euphemism  for 'down the leg side', flicked away to fine leg
slower ball here, Bopara plays around his front pad with a whirl of the wrists. Looks risky to me
ah, 'too straight' again. By which I mean wide down the leg side. Steyn striving for that stump-splattering yorker
very neat moment of cricket where a full, straight ball meets a full, straight bat in textbook defence
probably the best shot Bopara has played all morning here. Not many to chose from though. Touch shorter from Steyn outside off and a flowing back-foot drive earns a couple to point
fuller from Steyn and Bopara punches a drive to mid-on. Runs a single very swiftly, which is unusual for him
tossed up menacingly, Bopara nudges down the ground and finds the best defence by scampering to the other end
juicy full toss, but such are England's woes that Trott merely bunts a single down the ground
ah lovely shot, the best of the day. Overpitched from Tahir and Bopara leans into a fluid extra cover drive
this is almost as good from Bopara. Very soft hands turning the ball into the leg side and judging a couple well to bring up the 50 stand
lovely delivery, tossed up on a length spinning away. Bopara leans forward to defend
another flashing blade as Bopara drives outside off stump. Timed it perfectly but was fielded smartly at short cover
looks more uncertain than Tahir but starts well, dobbing up on a good length and Trott flicks to a vacant midwicket
good again from the bowler, the length dragged back a touch which forces Trott to defend
pushed carefully back to the bowler
dragged down a fraction too short but Trott punched back to the bowler
this time Trott beats the bowler, threading a drive down the ground
huge appeal from bowler and wicketkeeper as Bopara went back to flash and miss a cut from a length ball. Poor shot but an optimistic appeal
starts full outside off, Trott aims a reverse-tickle but  ends up yorking the ball with his glove
nudged into the midwicket region with the spin
ah good shot, it was short and sat up for it but England have missed out on a few this morning. Trott this time cut hard and square for four
pops forward to defend back to the bowler
touch shorter and Trott gets deep into his crease to punch back
shuffle down the crease to clip to long-on and keep the strike
little bit short and worked around the corner
slightly quicker ball and Bopara is very late on it. He's struggled against du Plessis so far
nudged very carefully towards midwicket
just a fraction shorter, flat too. Trott pushes to long-on
Bopara missed out here. Short but straight so Bopara had no room to time his cut
driven back to the bowler to end another good du Plessis over
Duminy from around the wicket means the leg side is opened up for Trott  to nudge into
a fraction short and Bopara is again keen to cut, but not finding the room for it
quicker and flatter from the bowler. Flicked into the leg side
Bopara gets a leading edge here to cover. He's just going through a bad patch at the moment
this starts straight but spins down the leg side
that'll do nicely for the batsman. Didn't quite time this but nurdled straight of midwicket
Trott pinches the strike but fiddling a single towards fine leg. Overs ticking by but South Africa just opening the smallest gap back for England here
fullish ball squeezed down to fine leg to jog another single
Bopara aims to whip a full ball around his front pad to fine leg, missed it and was struck in front. Luckily for him, it pitched outside leg stump
du Plessis drops his length a fraction and Bopara finally gets one of his cut shots away. Just for a single though
wow, this really rags. Bounce too and Trott misses a work to leg
firm connection this time, bunting into the leg side

oh Ravi Bopara. Nudged into the leg side, he took an age to turn here after being sent back by Trott for a single that did not exist. Eventually he dived in but the bat almost bounced up as he dived. Not the sharpest thing I've seen
Trott is playing a different match here, easy as you like on a cut shot and sauntering through for one
Duminy too short again and allows Bopara to unfurl his cut shot. No mistakes with the running this time
Trott wants to cut again but is cramped for room as Duminy finds some purchase
dragged from outside off stump to mid-on
some air from Duminy used by Trott to dink a single into the leg side
Bopara edges down the track but Duminy adjusts his length well, leaving defence the only option
Trott milks a single to long-on off the back foot
Bopara playing forward this time milks a single in just the same direction
this is a good over from England so far, Trott shoving a single down to long-on
too close to cut but Bopara wants the shot. Can't time it though
lovely delivery, touch of flight around off stump. Bopara forward and pushing back to du Plessis who tumbles to field smartly
shorter and it spins sharply, bounces too. Bopara stands tall but can't find a gap
Trott plays back when he should have played forward. Has to jab down in a hurry as a result
dots piling up as Trott pushes a full ball back to Duminy
precious single as Trott turns to deep square
that releases the pressure. Gone a long way, too. Bopara down the wicket and swinging through the line, pinging this back over the bowler's head and over the sightscreen too!
good follow-up delivery, flatter and quicker around off stump. Stabbed to point
Bopara opens the face a touch to steer a single
good start from Steyn, heading towards the top of off stump. Bopara leans forward into defence but looks rushed on the shot
slower ball from Steyn, running his fingers across the ball. Bopara again is forward and defending under eyes
ah, first sighting of reverse. Nothing dramatic but it tailed into Bopara, allowing him to turn his hands over the ball and send it to fine leg
slightly shorter, the line a touch wrong and Trott shrugs it away to fine leg
definite reverse here, swinging in late but Bopara's defences are solid
touch shorter, so no swing there. Very good line though and Bopara, with the softest of hands, pushes down the ground. Beats the bowler and steals the strike
finds spin straight away, landing it on a good line and length. Bopara leans the ball past cover to amble a single
trouble for Trott as some extra bounce and spin finds the edge. Slides one-bounce down to deep third man
really beautiful piece of timing from Trott here. Gets a slightly short ball and whips it square of the wicket, it rushes to the rope, beating the fine leg fielder who tried to skirt round
follows the boundary by pushing a single down the ground. Excellent batting
Bopara a touch less certain getting forward here
prodded back to the bowler in defence
Trott tries to run a fullish ball down to third man but it's too close to him and he can't squeeze it away
rare loose shot from Trott, a flat-footed drive dribbles off an inside edge

more excellent timing from Trott brings up a crucial fifty. Where would England be without him? All out I expect. Bunts a full delivery down the ground, beating a jumping bowler and sprawling mid-on fielder
Bopara gets a shorter ball that he stands tall to defend
Bopara is not quite as adept as Trott at working singles but picks up one here pushing a slower ball down the ground
very firmly driven here but straight to cover. Anderson will be watching Steyn's progress closely, this pitch really doesn't look one for the pitch-up skiddy merchants
nurdled around the corner. Bopara imagines there is a single but Trott is nothing if not a realist
prodded back to the bowler this time
with a flick of the wrists, Bopara turns a single to midwicket
Trott pops forward to defend to cover
this time he gets back and punches a slightly shorter offering to  deep cover

ooh, Bopara advanced in a menacing way, like he wanted the big shot down the ground, Peterson adjusted his line well, throwing outside off. Rather than try and drag a shot Bopara changed his mind and prodded to point
oooh! There's that googly, his Warwickshire team-mate didn't read it, aimed an expansive drive and the inside edge could have been fatal!
close again! If the googly won't get you the full toss, er, might. Slugged wide of long-on, Steyn hared up and in and dived full length, only to drop the ball as his elbows crashed to the ground
very neatly driven down the ground to get off strike
carefully defended this time back to the bowler

gone this time! Tahir gets his man after all! Plenty of overspin on this and dipped before bouncing a touch more, Trott was a fraction early and popped back wide of Tahir who dived to his left to cling on. Wild celebrations from him and England in the mire.
he's away first ball with a work off the hip into the leg side
pushed into the leg side
back of a length, defended back down the pitch
good line, keeps Prior in defence as he plays straight
punched firmly off the back foot to cover...building more pressure on England after that wicket
a slower ball outside off, left alone and it doesn't carry to van Wyk
fuller on off stump and defended to complete a good maiden
excitement from the bowler as Bopara gets an edge into the leg side but it falls well away from the keeper
on the back foot and pulled out to deep midwicket
gets down for a sweep and works it out to deep square
tossed up on middle and leg, Bopara works it down to long on
another sweep, this time from outside off which means it goes a touch squarer
wow, what a beauty...that has turned and bounced past Bopara's edge and also eluded the keeper. Plenty in this for the spinners
full outside off, driven to backward point
hint of inswing, maybe reverse swing, and Bopara turns it to midwicket
width outside off but he can't time his cut as there's no pace to work with and it dribbles to cover
waits longer this time and opens the face to third man
punched back down the pitch and Kallis dives to his right to make a good save
this time he finds space straight down the ground and keeps the strike
short outside off, Prior punches off the back foot down the ground
rocks back and cuts hard but picks out the man at cover
back foot again against another short ball, this time midwicket parries it with a fine dive that probably prevented a boundary
defend into the leg side
short and cut out to deep point
drives through the covers out to the sweeper
drags his first balls short and Bopara places it nicely backward of square on the off side, but the sweeper makes good ground
tossed up, drives down to long off
leans forward and defends, gets an inside edge into the leg side
powerful from Prior. Brings out the sweep and fetches it from outside off, sending it racing forward of square leg
back in defence as he plays to the off side
tight on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
speared towards the pads but Bopara can't capitalise
tapped into the covers, a sharp single and that's Bopara's fifty. His fifth in all, and how valuable it's been. More still needed of course. But he's laid the groundwork
too good for Prior! Tight to the line of off stump, climbing off the deck, grazing the edge and the keeper's lean run continues, as England's slide regains momentum!
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
down the leg side
half forward, a poked defence
very full but still generating steep bounce. Yardy digs this one out as it leaps in the crease
nudged into the gap at long on. Happy to size up the singles for now
twirled onto leg stump, attempted flick, misses out
not entirely convincing defence, worked back to the bowler
massive appeal as Yardy goes down on the sweep. Petersen is adamant, but that was going over
flicked off the hip
beautifully bowled, Bopara is beaten in flight as he drives hard-handed into the covers. A good eye gets him out of trouble
blocked with an angled bat, the ball hops backwards and nearly threatens the stumps
determined defence, dragged forward to block
short, but no great aggression. Bopara rolls his wrists on a controlled pull
round the wicket and Yardy is smothered for room. Nowhere to go there
down the track to defend, blocked off the inside edge to backward square
another block out to point, Yardy can't get going, but Bopara will be relieved he didn't steal the strike!
cracking shot, an aggressive sweep, hitting down on the ball all the way, and no-one can intercept
fully forward and blocked
Bopara dances in the crease and takes on the cut, but sharp work at point cuts off the runs
good work from Yardy, picking the gap at midwicket with a gentle tap off the toes
a wristy flick through the leg-side, not great power but another single
pushed back to the bowler. A better over for England, but it's all relative
attempted yorker, but floated into the toes and flicked through mid-on
direct hit from cover, and there's a review. Bopara is easily home, used the dive well
a massive breakthrough! Bopara is nailed lbw as Morkel nips one off the seam. It's gone to a review but it's tactical, as that is plumb. HawkEye says middle and leg, and he's gone
outside off, no stroke offered as Bresnan finds his bearings
a fraction wider on the crease, Bresnan defends
attempted yorker, splatted out to backward square. Just a single to end the over

wicket-to-wicket, and Bresnan is nailed in front of middle and leg! Another review. No issue with the no-ball, but there are several stumps visible. That's hard luck for the batsman, the leg stump was being clipped so it stays with the on-field umpire. Steyn has no need for a sighter!
solidly forward, and blocked
full toss, but straight. Pushed to cover
squeezed square, through point, tight line again
pulls the length back a bit, to keep Swann from planting his front foot
a hint of width, slapped into the covers, and Swann keeps the strike. Given Yardy's run-rate, that's no bad thing ...
looped onto the off stump, stroked into the covers
down on the sweep, no contact on the stroke. The only contact was with Swann's groin. Ouch
eager appeal but that was going down
switch hit from Swann! And he nails it as well! Pulled firmly through cover/midwicket for four
down the track, beaten in flight and defended
swished into the leg side, another single to keep the scorecard ticking
on the legs, helped round the corner
full, late swinging, sneaks through to the keeper
right up to the stumps, Yardy puts his bat in the way and scampers the single
clobbered! That's a flowing stroke from Swann, down the track, meeting the quick on the half-volley, and that's smacked through cover. His favourite stroke, and he played it well
looking for a single into the covers, though he kicks the turf because he feels that was another boundary ball - it sat up a touch and asked to be hit
slower ball, well directed. South Africa keep a firm grip on proceedings
a googly, nudged to point
another googly, and another limp dismissal. Not picked whatsoever, and an lofted slap ends up in the hands of short cover
Broad doesn't pick that at all as he came half forward and the  ball rolled through the gate and inches past leg stump!
half an appeal as Broad goes down on the sweep
a bigger appeal this time! Broad would definitely have reviewed that if he could, it was the googly, he didn't pick it on the sweep, and umpire Taufel raises the finger!
defended out to cover off the back foot
a bit of width outside off, a flat-footed poke finds thin air
outside off, jabbed defence but again no contact
an airy swat into the covers, Swann regains the strike
run off the face of the bat to short third man, as Swann picks off the single
a loud cry of "no!" as Anderson defends to gully
firm defence in front of off stump
another review as Swann is struck on the pad, looked leg-sided and sure enough it was... a spectacular waste of technology, but I guess South Africa can take a few liberties!
this beats everything. Sharp work on the fine leg boundary to save the boundary
good boshing from Swann, down the track, picks his spot and finds the midwicket boundary
drilled into the covers
an inside-out drive down the ground, gets a lot of air on the stroke, but Duminy runs round from mid-off to snaffle an sharp chance

inn2.comm: flat and quick from Yardy, no spin, quietly defended
again it's a good tight line, but no air or bite and Amla pops forward to defend
ah, don't give him width if you're a bowler. Amla is back in his crease and whipping his wrists through a cut shot to the deep cover rope
check-drive goes airily wide of cover for a single
some spin here takes it past Smith's inside edge to hit him on the pads. An appeal from England but only a gentle one
tuned off the pads to short midwicket to end a first over that was not nearly as dramatic as England's
decent start, desperately seeking swing, none there but the line is good and Amla punches to mid-off
pinged down a touch shorter, no hint of seam, no hint of swing. Amla pops up on his toes to defend
dangerous territory for Anderson, feeding Amla on his legs. The flick was powerful but straight to Strauss at short midwicket
good length here, no searching for swing that isn't there. Amla tucks to midwicket to defend
again Anderson is back of a length and Amla happily defends off the back foot
Amla pinches the strike by working this with the angle to deep square. Decent first over for Anderson but nothing to suggest he'll be a threat
ping, Amla's spring-loaded bat speeds this over a short extra cover and races to the rope
ooh, this did spin a fraction, kissed the edge but bounced short of slip diving to his right. Might have  carried to a second slip
Amla timed this better than he thought, which meant he really had to hurry to get through for a single to mid-off
Smith works with a heavy bottom hand to Bopara at deep square who fumbles
flat and a hint of width too, Amla cuts firmly but straight to Bell at backward point
reasonably slower from Yardy here, not flight as such but almost. Amla weighs it all up before prodding to leg
Anderson aims full, going across the left hander. Finds a thick outside edge than runs down to third man
width allows Amla to fling his hands at this and it skids down to third man
poor ball, real horrible one. Wide down the leg side, all Smith had to do was get a faint tickle, he got plenty and fine leg had no chance
better delivery this time, hammered back of length and around off stump. Smith tried to heave a pull shot but it was through him too swiftly
Smith will forever pick singles off his pads
back of a length again to finish the over. Amla stands tall and defends to midwicket
Smith works with the angle, and what spin is on offer, to push this to deep midwicket
hint of with and steered to point
far too much width this time and Amla needs no invitation. Throws his arms at it and it scoots away towards deep cover where Bopara fields well to save the boundary
Amla is hanging leg side of the ball and pinging through the off side, to great effect
and another couple, straighter this time on the drive. Would have been more if Broad had not fielded excellently at cover to intercept
and again Yardy is outside off stump which allows Amla to drive handsomely, just a single but South Africa coasting this at the moment
starts well straight away, pushing up on a length and beating Amla's work to leg
Amla is a touch late on this. Bresnan is actually quite brisk. Quicker than you think, heavy ball, hits the bat hard and assorted other cliches
ooh, strangled appeal from someone, not the bowler though, as Amla swishes across the line and misses
tucked away into the midwicket region
Bresnan is lucky to get away with this, touch short and wide but Smith didn't time his clump
similar delivery but Smith was content this time to run a single to third man
starts well, touch of flight, Smith pops forward and defends at off stump
hint of spin here, dip too. Smith leant forward and had to adjust to the spin in defence
touch more flight but Smith was solidly behind his block this time
huge appeal and Swann floated this up around leg stump and spun it back onto the pads. Big angle to straighten from and the umpire wasn't convinced. Neither were England, who opted not to review
ooh, careful defence from Smith
very good maiden over from Swann ends with Smith popping forward in defence
Amla latches onto to width with such gentle violence. Whirl of wrists sends this to third man
Smith aims a leg side tickle, misses with his bat but not his pads and it dribbles away
back of a length, Amla gets back and tries to force though the off side. Touch too quick on him
again Amla is late on a pull shot to Bresnan. I haven't seen Bresnan pulled effectively this tournament
oh dear. It's Pietersen again. England are fuming. It was worked to Pietersen at at midwicket and he flung the ball at the stumps, wide of everyone and it ran away for four
solid forward defence to end an over that was ruined by that shoddy piece of work from Pietersen
worked against the spin on offer to midwicket. First run off Swann
Amla watches this carefully onto the bat and turns it behind him for a single
this really rags, kicks off a length and climbs past the edge. Get a gully in, get three slips in!
again Swann is really putting the revs on this and it turns a long way from outside off stump
that. is. a. cracker. This pitched around leg stump and shot past off. Groping defensive bat had no chance
Smith solidly forward this time to negate the spin in defence. Swann is a threat but England have no other spinners
Amla walks down the wicket, then across to the off side. Bresnan hammers it in shorter and wider to follow and Amla steers to deep point
beaten outside off. No real reason why, Bresnan just angling the ball across Smith
neatly done from Smith, turning the strike over by clipping around the corner
finally some good fielding from England. It's come from Ravi Bopara diving to stop a cut shot
Bresnan solidly on a length and line leaving Amla no option but defence
such a good shot this, just the slightest hint of width and Amla speeds his hands through a square drive.
round the wicket, speared into the pads, turned to short fine leg
two slips in place and that beats them both! What a ripper! Turned and bounced, and looped off the splice over the cordon's head!
driven, loosely, inches short of short cover. Smith is all at sea
this one hustles through as Smith squirts a defensive prod to midwicket
gives himself room for a swat through cover, but there's no width to work with
brilliant over, this one is punched straight back to the bowler. He's England's only hope, but he needs to take a bagful
big turn for Yardy as well as Amla wafts loosely through the covers
too much width, and clumped through point
pushed into the covers
turn from outside off, a bit of an inside edge saves the lbw appeal
works with the spin, off the pads and down to fine leg
well snaffled at full stretch by Ian Bell at point. England are brawling, but they have to make a breakthrough soon
swept hard but straight to deep backward square. Swann won't mind, he's got Smith in his sights again
gutsy from Smith, he's not picking Swann's subtleties at all, so he gave himself room and leathered a cover drive
tossed up on leg stump, defended
on the pads again, nudged to midwicket for a sharp single
that's a measured stroke from Amla, forward and probes the gap at cover. Placement over timing
on leg stump, defended again. A good over for South Africa, Swann is kept waiting again
fully forward and defended
how did that get through, tight line, straightened, too a thin under-edge and the ball snuck through Prior's legs! Nearly hit the helmet as well
trying to work everything to leg, gets one through this time
head right over the ball, and driven out to deep point
solid defence on off stump
tossed up and driven to midwicket

that's a stinking delivery! Perfect length, spitting turn and bounce, Prior gathers well, up by his armpit, and the umpires review because they can tell what on earth has happened ... Looks as though there was the thinnest slither of glove on the ball as he fizzed by ... yes, there quite clearly was. This will be given out ... surely? The wait is eternal. Well, the umpires made a meal of it, but the right decision was reached in the end
floated into the blockhole, and Kallis thumps through mid-on. That was a poor first ball for a new batsman of his class
massive appeal as Kallis lobs a simple catch to short leg, but off what? Another review ... Looks like nothing but thighpad ... indeed, that is what the umpires say
into position early and down on a jabbed sweep. Lobs into the leg side
forward, and flicked to midwicket for another single
tossed up, and turned to short leg. Another incisive over, but he's halfway through his spell
firm drive, half stopped in the covers
thick edge, flies safely down to third man
rising from a good length, Amla rides the bounce and fends a single to third man
fuller and straighter, defended back to the bowler
that one tails in a touch from outside off, very full. Half an appeal for lbw, but always safe
excellent over, Broad already looks more limber than he did against Ireland. This one is tight to off stump and pushed out to point
tossed up outside off, Amla works with the spin and picks the gap in the leg-side
blocked to midwicket. Tight line again
a fraction more width, and Kallis is onto it in a flash, an aggressive sweep, perfectly timed through square leg
was that a chance? If so a tough one, off the under-edge of another sweep, and leg slip dives to his left
swept again, not timed
forward and defended to cover
forward and defended, tight line from Broad again
punched to mid-off
full and straight, and Amla is gone! He tried to run the ball through third man, but the ball got big on him, and deflected down into the base of the stumps!
squirted out to point
excellent bowling from Broad, a bit of reverse swing, and a very full length
that's incredible timing, another fine ball from Broad and that looked like a thick inside-edge from a late inswinger. But it's fizzed through midwicket
forward in a clatter of limbs, worked to midwicket
squeezed into the leg side again
slow spin from outside off, defended back to the bowler to a shout of "yes Swanny"
forward with bat and pad, defended to cover
jabbed to midwicket, Swann is looking less of a threat without a left-hander to torment
blocked into the off side. Swann is running out of overs
width outside off, a bit of swing
edged, and did that carry? Yes, Prior says it did, and that's another one down! Width again, Kallis chased it, and suddenly, this one isn't quite over ...
fully forward, and du Plessis defends
clear evidence of reverse swing, this one tails onto the toes and it's defended
blocked firmly into the covers, eluded one fielder, but the second, KP, intercepts with a tumble
misdirected into the pads, clipped firmly to midwicket
decent start, he's bowl some dross but this is useful, touch of bounce around off and it glides off the face towards third man
jump and turn, du Plessis is happy enough turning to leg where Bell fields smartly
lucky this spun sharply because it started very wide, but this is a good start from Pietersen
touch fuller and du Plessis leans forward in defence
big spin again from outside off stump, du Plessis jumping to nudge to leg
plenty of noise from the England fielders, they have about a 20-run window to turn this into a nailbiter
de Villiers watches very carefully and runs this off the face to third man
back of length from Broad, finds decent carry and forced du Plessis back in defence
very solid, sturdy defence to mid-off. Broad just holding a length and line and hoping the pitch will give him something
beaten, exactly the same formula as the last delivery but this seems to keep a bit low and hold its line, past a groping outside edge
du Plessis pierces the dot-ball bubble before pressure builds too much by steering to wide third man
speared fuller and straighter and camly worked to mid-on
swept carefully, with a bit of bottom edge around the corner
du Plessis advances but can't catch up with this delivery and has to hurriedly work to leg
stronger shot this time, solidly pushed wide of mid-on
de Villiers rushes across to the off side to spoon this towards fine leg, very swift running turned a tight two into a secure couple
this is pushed away into space
gentle appeal from the bowler mainly as this thuds off the pad on its way to Anderson at slip. Who was not at all interested
Bresnan starts full and homes in on off stump, meeting a very secure forward block
no hint of reverse and de Villiers uses the angle into the pads to help it on its way around the corner
length ball this time, touch slower perhaps, driven without much timing to cover
du Plessis waits on this to glide it off the face to third man
too much width on offer and de Villiers crunches a cut away to deep point
full-faced to mid-off to end a quiet over
de Villiers shuffles down and eases this to long-on to jog a single
plenty of spin out there but the batsman uses it to prod to midwicket
du Plessis stretches  across to the off side to defend this
100 up for South Africa as Pietersen lands a long half-volley that is squeezed out with excellent timing to the cover boundary
boundary followed by single, dropped with soft hands into the leg side
milked square of the wicket. Riskless and mighty effective
Bresnan goes full in search of swing, finds a touch into the batsman who squeezes it out
de Villiers stands tall and threads this wide of point for a couple
genuine offspinner from Bresnan here but it's neatly tickled around the corner. Looks very easy for South Africa at the moment
better delivery here, swinging in a touch and hurrying a defence
strangled appeal from the bowler. Bresnan as settled into bowling full, which is promising for the future games
full and straight again for du Plessis to dig out
this spins again swiftly, jagging back and bouncing from outside off
de Villiers aims a reverse-sweep which he doesn't get near connecting. Draws plenty of ooohs from the England fielders
plenty of turn again but de Villiers is more secure in defence
again Pietersen finds a length and line and nothing on offer
swept, and swept hard to deep square. Excellent over from Pietersen, nothing dragged down short
good over finishes with an inside edge that goes onto pad and loop out of the reach of slip
tight line and length, no swing on offer here and calmly negotiated
prodded into the leg side, du Plessis came a long way up in search of a single, before slamming on the breaks, turning and haring back
Bresnan hitting a fullish length around middle and off, nothing for the batsman to work with
de Villiers' bat here is almost as straight as the delivery, pushing to mid-off
very similar delivery, no room for de Villiers to free his arms at and blocked again. Bresnan needs a strong finish
solid and secure forward defence to end the maiden over.
nudged around the corner
quietly defended this time from de Villiers
flat, no great turn but the line is adequate. Pushed wide of cover
ankle-high bounce here, hint of spin too and du Plessis looked hurried in defence
spin here finds a leading edge that heads out  to cover
ah, wonderful shot with pressure just beginning to build. du Plessis hops to the leg side to give himself room and threads a perfectly-timed drive between mid-off and extra cover
boundary is followed by a couple, using the angle to pick off around the corner
wide ball slapped straight to cover. Fortune for the bowler there
de Villiers walks across his stumps to create an angle which he then uses to nudge towards fine leg
sloppy stuff behind the stumps but the bowler is at fault. Good yorker bunted back to Bresnan who hurled back to Prior on the half volley
this sits up a touch and again de Villiers nailed a drive, but picked out cover
cover was set deep on the boundary for the last ball and de Villiers found the man by hammering a wide delivery
tossed onto the leg stump
good delivery, sharp turn and beats the edge of a loose drive
well bowled again, open face to another big turner, and lucky to get away with it
tossed up again, played straight back down the track
good shot to a decent ball, an urgent cramped cut, but places it well. Decent running to get du Plessis on strike
defended on the back foot
wicket to wicket first up. Defended
poor delivery but Prior does well to save the boundary, parrying down the leg-side
fenced out to point, better line and length
nearly a mix-up! A stab to gully, and an instant call is met with a loud "no!" The shy comes in and misses
worked up to mid-on, more calmly done this time
a loose drive as the bottom hand comes off the bat. In the air for a while, but doesn't carry to mid-off

Anderson has bowled him, I think! Yes, he has! de Villiers left alone outside off, the ball zipped through to the keeper, who caught it safely but belatedly noticed the bails were on the ground! Replays prove that Anderson just snicked the top of off, and that is a massive wicket
pushed out to point

instant panic as Swann comes back into the attack! A flick off the toes, a sharp piece of work at short leg, and du Plessis' headless-chicken run leaves him well out of the frame as Prior whips the bails off!
van Wyk survives his first ball
turned into the leg side, and short leg can't cut it off
steps back to attempt a cut, but not timed
appreciable turn from outside off, another fine over
excellent delivery, wicket-to-wicket to the left-hander. Defended on off

down the leg side, and there's a massive appeal! The finger goes up, but Duminy has reviewed. The speed with which he did so suggests he knows something, but the replays are pretty inconclusive. Snicko would be handy in this situation, but the third umpire will have to tell the onfield umpire to make the final call, I reckon. Nope, he's seen enough to change his mind!
defended on off stump
gadzooks, no need for a review on that one! Duminy's off pole has been utterly and totally detonated! Unplayable nut from Anderson, swinging, straightening, flattening!
punched out to cover with a flow of the blade
tapped out to point again, that would have been very tight if the shy had hit
a wild slap, and misses! Sharp spin to the left-hander again
beats the edge with another beauty, and Prior whips off the bails for a stumping. Back foot is anchored
oh my God, that is too good! Round the wicket, pitches on a sixpence, straightens and beats edge and stump by a whisker!
tapped to backward point, and a scurry for a single. The most urgent call of the day!
floated up to the right-hander, and defended. He'd sooner have the leftie on strike....
down on the sweep, well outside the line. No review, but what drama!
massive appeal, propping forward and strikes the knee-roll, no review taken
missed stumping! Peterson comes down the track and Prior fumbles the chance!
forward and defended
a sharp single to cover
big turner from outside off. van Wyk shoulders arms
that's a cracking over, right on the spot and exploding into the pads from an off-stump line
short and hittable, driven to point
over the wicket to the left-hander. Blocked to cover
a fraction shorter, but straight enough. Mid-on gathers with a tumble
loud shouts from the close fielders, full length and tight line.
there was width on that one and Peterson had a swipe,  but couldn't cash in!
that's the wicket! Outside off, Peterson drives flat-footedly, Prior clings on, and now England really are favourites!
outside off, sharp lift, and was that a drop by Prior? Yes it was, but a tough one.
pushed forward, a scamper to cover
tossed up outside off, but Steyn's drive dribbles to wide mid-off
flicked out to midwicket, but England are sharp
down the leg-side and that's the first loose ball for a long while. No matter how they come, fine leg can't intercept!
back on the money with the last delivery, outside off and turning back in. Defended
lucky from Yardy, a high full-toss, but van Wyk can't capitalise
width, and cut firmly to the cover sweeper, Broad
good delivery this time, round the wicket, pitching middle and straightening
a touch too short, and carved out to cover
tossed up, very straight, pushed back to the bowler
slower delivery, and that was pants. Yardy's arm dropped in delivery, and was easily punched through the covers.
A polite appeal for a catch at slip as van Wyk misses a sweep
outside off, chopped to point
tight line from KP,  Steyn works with the spin and picks a single to midwicket
tossed right up, but cover collects a firm drive
steps back to whip a single to midwicket. The bite has gone out of England's attack for the moment. But Swann has one more over up his sleeve
round the wicket to finish the over, flicked to midwicket.
short and wide and somehow Broad gets away with a loosener. Just kept a little low to creep under the swish
edged, and what an edge! Ball keeping low again and shoots off the bottom edge past the stumps, bouncing over Prior for precious runs. Target under 30 now
so calm from Steyn, he looks capable of taking South Africa over the line. Stands up tall to a short ball and drops to leg
better length here from the bowler, Steyn is always happy to drive so this rib-tickling length is the way to go. Seems to have hurt Steyn a touch, the physio is out there
Broad hammers back of a length again but Steyn eases into line. He presence is really soothing the pressure
again Steyn pops up on his toes to defend. But an excellent over from Broad. England's bowlers have found their range just when the batsmen lost theirs
van Wky drops with the softest of hands to cover to steal a single. Not the exploding turn there was before for Pietersen
Pietersen switches to around the wicket, again no great spin here and Steyn works around the corner
left alone outside off stump
creamily driven but straight to cover who pings back the return
plenty of ooohs and aaahs and Pietersen leaping and yelping, but the result is a calmly-pushed single to the off side
brilliant from Steyn, such clear thinking under intense pressure. Sees a touch of flight, backs his ability and thwacks back down the ground. That will be Pietersen's work done I suspect
inside-edge hammers into boot! Broad is up in arms but it's a good delivery, holding an off-stump line
pressure telling on van Wyk there, no need to do this, flat-footed swing outside off. The ball burrows under
Broad aims yorker, lands it but is driven firmly to mid-off
lucky for the bowler here! Shortish angled down the leg side, van Wyk probably tried to do too much and ended up edging into his body
Steyn looks the key man here. He resists Broad's off-stump line calmly
cool and careful from Steyn. Speared in full but Steyn stepped inside the line to pick off the single to deep square and keep the strike
Anderson went looking for reverse but found nothing and it speared down leg
dropped! That could be the game! Full from Anderson again, Steyn hammered it straight back, Anderson stuck out a left hand and the ball went straight in, but straight out again
slipped down the leg side again. Too far and that takes the target under 20
Anderson pulls back his length, doesn't find any lateral movement and Steyn is solid in defence
ooh, beaten outside off stump. Just nipped away late and Steyn groped for it
fired in much fuller, the late swing Anderson needs isn't there for him though and Steyn jabs away
full, swinging in and a meaty Steyn inside edge prevents alarm
top over ends with a yorker. Anderson doing everything here  but can't burst through Steyn
tossed up to start, touch of spin but van Wyk calmly defends
again this is very neatly turned around the corner where smart fielding saves the run
van Wyk not trying anything against Swann here, just content to block
good signs for South Africa, backing themselves in the tightest situation. van Wyk aims a reverse-sweep through the newly-vacated slip position
Steyn hanging back, just one more delivery for him to block away. Will Swann gamble with flight?

no he doesn't and Steyn keeps him out. Almost there now for South Africa. Swann single-handedly gave England the belief they could do this but his work is done now. Looks like Anderson's reverse is the only threat now
short, very short. Why I don't know but van Wyk swats it without much timing to midwicket
full, much better, attacking the stumps. an Wyk jabs it back out to the bowler
mighty effective stuff from an Wyk. Offered width he calmly steers a single to point
Anderson not daring full for Steyn this time, short of a length and Steyn strong in defence
fuller here and Steyn mistimes a drive, hits into the ground and it loops up to mid-on, enough time for Steyn to hurtle a single
carefully defended away. Just soaking up all the tension and pressure
that's poor from mid-on. Hanging back on the ring Broad has allowed Steyn to push a single
is there another twist!? Surely not? Bresnan strikes just when England needed it. van Wyk looking to cut but it was too close for the shot, ended up bottom edging onto middle stump
just a hint of width and that's all the invitation Morkel needs to swing his long, long arms through the ball. An outside edge sends it skimming  down to third man
solid, pressure-defining defence from Steyn
touch short, and too wide from Bresnan. Steyn pops up on his toes and steers a very confident cut shot through a diving point. Single figures needed now. Wonder how Tahir feels
excellent bouncer, sharp and rearing into the helmet. Steyn fends it off and gets the ultimate bonus of keeping the strike
Broad has nailed Steyn here. Full, nipped back a touch and struck flush in front. Looked stone dead, the umpire agreed and despite a review Steyn had to go.
wow! Tahir aims an almighty heave through the off side. The inside edge skews away through midwicket to get him off strike. That'll do nicely
Broad spears in a full delivery from around the wicket and Morkel clears his front leg to try and thwack down the ground. Straight to mid-off

Broad has done it! England take the game! South Africans, don't mention the C-word! Somehow England have pulled off a stunning win having been the wrong side of two close results before. It was full and up there to drive, Morkel aimed a big swing but could only feather through to Prior. Broad has conjured up a stunning final over to win the game, England's fielders are going ballistic, not so knackered anymore!
